reviews.title: Would not recommend
reviews.text: The hotel is in a good location for the SECC venue. The rooms were of a high standard except the plug sockets were on the floor which meant that you had to plug in kettle and leave it on the floor and dry your hair with your head under the desk and not in view of the mirror. What really let the hotel down was the staff. The restaurant, breakfast and bar staff were rude, barely smiled and were inattentive. We were told that there were no tables available for us to partake in the hot buffet, when only thirty of the 100 couverts were occupied (and looking at the forward bookings, they were only expecting thirty more diners over the next two hours). The tea at breakfast was stone cold and food was poor. This hotel gets the basics wrong which ruins the overall surface appeal. I would not recommend this hotel to others.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed in the Crowne Plaza for two nights and thoroughly enjoyed it. The hotel is magnificent with modern decor and it is spotless. The staff were very friendly and helpful and have to be commended on this. The rooms were an average size with ensuite facilities. We ate in the restaurant both nights (buffet style) and we were spoiled for choice - it is not badly priced either. The breakfast is equally as good. The train station is quite close by and there are always taxis lined up outside the hotel, where it costs approx £3.00 to travel to the main shopping areas/bars. We would definitely recommend this hotel.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

reviews.title: Club Rooms Not Worth the Extra Money!!!!!
reviews.text: We stayed here on the 9th Feb 2008 and I have to say I was really dissappointed with the Club Room. I booked this for my husbands birthday and after having stayed in a standard room previously as it was a special occasion I decided to book a club room, which in the in room literature it decribes it as being a more comfortable room with snacks and access to the club lounge.

reviews.title: Not for smokers
reviews.text: The room we stayed in was exactly the same as a standard room with the only difference being a flat screen TV, I don't know about you but for me that doesn't make the room more comfortable!!! Apart from feeling a little ripped off with the the fact we didn't get this more comfortable room, the rooms are nice, could be finished a little better we had wallpaper peeling off beside the bed and above the main mirror in the room.

reviews.title: Hogmany Ball
reviews.text: Then there was the problem with the Club Lounge!!! This hotel has 2 floors of club rooms the 15th and the 16th, the club lounge is on the 15th floor with only 4 tables, yes 4 tables. We tried to get into the lounge about 6pm on the Saturday night however as you can imagine with only 4 table is was full, we then asked if we could take a drink back to our room only to be told that you can't take drinks out of the lounge. For me one of the main points of booking a club room was so we could go somewhere quiet for a drink before going out for our meal however this was far from the case not only was it full it was also full of children running around and screaming at each other!!! We did try again at 7pm and it was still full and then again at around 7.30 when we eventually got in. I did complain to the hotel on both counts and was told that all rooms are of the same standard (strange when the literature suggests a different thing and the reason for the lounge being so busy was they has a 200 people dinner dance on and the hotel was busy - I suggest this is not my problem if the hotel offers this service then it should be large enough to cope with at least 50% of guests using it as any one time the did refund half of the upgrade cost however by that point it had already wasted our stay.)

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: The location of the hotel is really good for the SECC and doesn't cost much in a taxi to get into the city centre - however after my last stay I won't be back.

reviews.title: Consistency is key
reviews.text: This hotel is a good standard 'corporate' facility, my main beef is that the website gives no indication that it is entirely non-smoking, including all bedrooms. Room availability sometimes states that rooms are non-smoking, others come up with a 'no preference' symbol next to them and in my naivety I had assumed these are smoking rooms, particularly as the website asks the booker to state a preference for smoking or non-smoking accommodation.

Stayed one night in July. Great views from the window and a very comfortable room. The staff were all very friendly and helpful; service was prompt and efficient. There was a wedding the night I stayed and I wasn't disturbed by it at all. Breakfast was an amazing buffet selection and, although travelling on my own, I was seated discretely and well looked after. Very professional and business like. Would recommend.

reviews.text: Stayed here after works christmas night in one of the suites downstairs so got room as special rate which was v.good. 1st off were given room with 2 singles when we originally asked for double one quick call to reception & we got moved rooms. Room inside was very nice remember being in hotel a longtime ago & was impressed with improvements. Complimentary bathrobes were nice. Liked how at end of evening were 2 hotel staff man-ing the lifts so that only people with a room key were allowed to enter, somehow a guy still managed to end up and was outside the room opposite ours kicking the door and shouting til 3am, i feel asleep though due to the comfy beds was person i was sharing room with who had to suffer the noise...overall ok but prefer malmaison glasgow a bit more pricey but better service i feel.

reviews.text: We stayed using our Priority points. Had to pay for breakfast as an extra for £10 per head which was fine. On the 14th floor- would have been nice to have been offered an upgrade or use of club lounge as a priority club holder- but maybe it was too busy. Bar staff were excellent- very pleasant. Breakfast was great- good range. Bed was comfy. Something wrong with air con in the room-loose dial but fixed immediately. Covered walkway as others mention to the SECC and also to the car park. Range of restaurants within walking distance- the Yen Rotunda is good. Small quibble- housekeeping...hair on the toilet seat cover, in the bathtub and surrounding the tub- overall, the bathroom was clean -so can only summaise that it is the hair of the room cleaner- still not a welcome sight. Must compliment the manager for taking the time to always respond- hallmark of good management. I have contributed to Tripadvisor for years and travelled on business around the world- I think this manager is the first I have seen who consistently puts in a response. Well done! Hope his senior managers acknowledge his attention to duty!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel is really good. A little in need of an upgrade, maybe, but probably a bit soon yet. Fantastic views, friendly staff who take the time to make sure you enjoy your Glasgow stay, spacious rooms, secure car parking (£6 a day is a bit steep but this is Glasgow and you won't do much better) and close to town (a pleasant 25 minutes if you walk and a very cheap taxi ride if you don't). Our only gripe is the WiFi. If its good enough for a farmhouse in rural Inverness to give free WiFi, then its good enough for you, Glasgow. And at £10 for 12 hours it would equate to £600 a month if that is what your normal ISP charged. Extortionate and unnecessary. That aside, there's not much to complain about here and, at the price, very good value for money.
reviews.title: Good value!

reviews.text: We were staying at the hotel for a music weekend which included all our meals and entertainment. It was just such a perfect venue, the sun was shining when we arrived and the hotel was just fantastic. We were warmly greeted and also bid farewell to by Catherine and Marik on reception. The two girls were excellent and just could not do enough for you, they both had striking personalaties and are a absolute assest to this hotel. As they are probaly the first members of staff you encounter on arrival, they certainly set the standard. We ate in the restaurant both nights and the setting was lovely in the dining room as was the excellent food. Breakfast was something else, it was buffet style and had something for everyone, the food was fresh and hot, can honestly say one of the best buffet breakfasts I have had. We met a local couple who live just 6 miles from the hotel and they regularly stay there to enjoy an meal in the restaurant and the breakfast in the morning ( a good sign). We noticed a lot of airline pilots and crew, this is yet another good sign for high standards. Our room was extremly comfortable and spotlessly clean, it had a small fridge, air conditioning and the beds were very comfortable, we were overlooking the river on the 6th floor, which was very pleasant. Overall for the size of this hotel it has a most friendly atmostsphere and I would not hesiate to recommend it to anyone. It is conveniently located and we got a train into Central Station for £1.30 and a taxi back for £6. Overall I would rate it 11 out of 10, special thanks to Iwona Radkowska from food and beverages department who looked after us immensely during our stay, sorry for keeping you out of bed to the wee small hours. I look forward to my next visit to this hotel.

We booked 2 rooms on the 16th floor so we could use the complimentary club lounge on the 15th floor. The rooms were spacious and clean. Good A/C and TV, kettle etc. The bed was huge, only slight downside was that the sheets were a bit polyestery rather than cotton, but if that doesn't bother you then they were very white and fresh looking. Big fluffy white towels, and beautiful bathroom with all the usual bottles of potions. We used the pool for an afternoon swim, which was very pleasant. My son ordered a meal from room service, which he said was tasty. The breakfast was excellent, great choice of every type of sausage, fruits, breads, eggs etc, and the staff were friendly and eager to please. The location was great, with excellent views, we would definitely go back again.

description: Welcome to Crowne Plaza Glasgow. A modern and stylish hotel overlooking the River Clyde, with a covered walkway to the Scottish Exhibition & Conference Centre (SECC), Crowne Plaza Glasgow is an excellent choice for the business and leisure traveller. With 283 air conditioned contemporary bedrooms and suites, all fully equipped with Smart televisions, trouser press, hairdryer, iron and ironing board, tea/coffee making facilities and wireless internet access. The spacious Club Rooms boast Kingsized beds with stunning river views, Smart TVs and exclusive access to our Club Lounge, with complimentary refreshments to relax or hold informal meetings. The Leisure Club includes an indoor pool, equipped gym, sauna, spa and steam room. Alternatively, treat yourself to a massage or beauty treatment in Isis, our in-house Beauty Salon. There are 15 conference/functions suites, including a dedicated boardroom with plasma screen, to accommodate all types of events. Crowne Plaza Glasgow is located directly opposite the Glasgow Science Centre, the BBC and STV Headquarters and the nearby Transport Museum and Tall Ship visitor attraction. Easy access to shopping areas such as Braehead, Buchanan Galleries, St Enoch and Argyle Street make this a great leisure destination. The hotel is non-smoking throughout.
